Maxime Kawawa-Beaudan

I am a research scientist at J.P. Morgan AI Research. I hold an M.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and a B.A. in Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley. As a member of Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research, one of the world’s foremost AI research labs, I worked on robotics, deep reinforcement learning, and computer vision.

When I’m not researching AI, I like to write and make videos. This portfolio highlights some of my work, both technical and non-technical.

Reach out to me at maxime.jkb@gmail.com to see a full resume!

Video Production

  • Project Rewind — a project documenting the process of digitizing over 100 hours of 8mm home video -- how and why to do it
  • 3 Principles for Starting Over — a project documenting my move to New York
  • A Gift for a Friend — a project documenting the process of building a small token of friendship
  • Dreamless — a video about dealing with aimlessness
  • An Early Memory — a multimedia project I undertook to composite a reading of a freewrite from my notebook with music and film
  • 1 Week 7 Drawings - a weekly diary of drawings as short content for YouTube Shorts

Journalism

  • Click to view "The Legacy Remains as Hardimans and Redwood Part" — a long-form feature piece profiling a family business (originally published online as immersive multimedia, now available only in provided print form)
  • Click to view "The Hidden Roots of Redwood" — a long-form feature piece profiling a custodian (originally published online as immersive multimedia, now available only in provided print form)
  • Click to view "Cohen gets 'tide' up in the surfing lifestyle" — profile of an outdoorsman and science teacher
  • Click to view "For Ecuador voyagers, the story didn’t end with return" — narrative news piece based on the first-person account of an earthquake survivor
